intro: Millettia urophylloides var. urophylloides, commonly known as the red-stemmed legume, is a flowering plant species belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical research.
